questions.text: a) Does premise located near to any contamination source? If yes, are the preventive action has been taken to minimise the contamination risk? If premise is located near contamination?

h) Equipments & utensils used are in good condition and made from appropriate material?
i) Procedure for maintenance & calibration are available?

l) Corrective actions are recorded & implemented when measuring and monitoring devices deviated.

n) Ice produced from potable water of reliable sources and kept away from contamination?

a) Controls are identified and implemented at each processing step to reduce biological hazard (temperature, humidity, acidity, etc).
b) Effective practices to prevent biological cross contamination are implemented.
c) Procedure for chemical used throughout the processing chain are available and implemented.
d) Chemicals used in food product and/or in food production are within specified limit (concentration, minimum/maximum level), ie: additives, sanitizers, etc. Relevant records are available.
e) No prohibited additives are used.
f) Effective practices to prevent chemical cross contamination are implemented.
g) Controls are identified and implemented at each processing step to reduce physical hazard (sieves, metal detector, etc).
h) Effective practices to physical chemical cross contamination are implemented.
i) Allergen, allergen traces & potential causes of cross contamination are identified documented.
j) Allergen & traces of allergen are declared on the packaging label. (Traces of allergen only for products that is CODEX HACCP certified).

a) Packaging material used minimises contamination, and prevent damages to the product.

j) Adequate storage are provided for raw material, work-in-progress, finished goods, & non-food product.

l) Storage condition is appropriate to minimize deterioration to food (ie: temperature, humidity, lighting, ventilation etc).
